medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe irritability, hypersomnia, and multiple somatic symptoms.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 8 months ago, characterized by increasing irritability and daily symptoms including stomachaches, tingling and pain in arms and legs, dizziness, anorexia, and severe fatigue. Patient also reported sleeping up to 13 hours per night. Symptoms worsened with increased isolation from friends, loss of interest in activities, and deteriorating school performance, including failing mathematics.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of celiac disease diagnosed at age 8, with prior episodes of severe vomiting requiring intravenous hydration, and a previous diagnosis of anxiety and depression.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with thyroid disease, multiple relatives (aunts, uncle, grandmother) with celiac disease, a paternal uncle with bipolar disorder, and relatives with anxiety, depression, or ADHD.
medical_history.social_history: Lived with parents and younger sister; no discussion of smoking, alcohol, or drug use.
